definition: to forget one's manners/to forget oneself/to lose self-control (in a situation)

sentences.english: Half of them are assigned to the blunder condition.
sentences.chinese: 实验中出现了采访者失态的环节。

sentences.english: "Oh, aren't you?" said Carrie, with an unwarrantable feeling.
sentences.chinese: “哦，你不回去吗？”嘉莉问，显得有些失态。

sentences.english: Don't ask me what. I'm not quite at the growing-dahlia stage.
sentences.chinese: 不要再问了，在大丽花生长期我容易失态。

sentences.english: That's the blunder. That's the pratfall.
sentences.chinese: 这就是失态环节，让人难堪。
这就是所谓的“失态效应。

sentences.english: Chantal would have considered it ill- mannered to show surprise.
sentences.chinese: 钱特尔会认为表现出吃惊是失态的。

sentences.english: Now, the classic experiment, the classic pratfall experiment, is just a beautiful one to describe.
sentences.chinese: 失态效应“的经典实验，描述起来，很迷人。

sentences.english: I will, if you forgive me for getting drunk.
sentences.chinese: 我会的，只要你能原谅我的酒后失态。
总之，这是关于“失态效应“的实验。

sentences.english: Woman drive Tang if Han voice a startled, this just discovers that ego has already rude in action.
sentences.chinese: 女子被唐若涵声音一惊，这才发现自己已经失态了。

sentences.english: He immediately realized his faus pas and quickly covered his mouth with his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他随即知道失态，忙伸手按住了口。

sentences.english: He must have been nervous, but he never faltered.
sentences.chinese: 他一定很紧张，却没有失态。

definition: slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
